availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. Mott (Caldwell co., ky, physician, asst surg (usa))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph A. Mott and Lucinda S. Mott. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as assistant surgeon from November 21, 1863, to December 19, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 302B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 821.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 475.
"Dr J D Mott," Find A Grave, Memorial #18628075, accessed May 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18628075.
